intro: Lychnophora sericea, commonly known as silky lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
